intro: Melicope vaupelii, commonly known as the Hawaiian melicope, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rutaceae family, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats within the native forests of Hawaii. Due to habitat loss and invasive species, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts.
